sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Good afternoon, you're watching Euronews Now. It's Thursday the 10th of February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I'm Andrea Bolaitho and these are your top stories this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia and Belarus begin military drills close to Ukraine's border, while a new round of diplomatic talks gets underway today in Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I didn't kill anyone, claims Bataclan attacks suspect Salah Abdesalam in court in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: His trial continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And at the Winter Olympics in Beijing, figure skating gold medals on hold after an athlete tests positive for a banned substance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: for a banned substance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russia and Belarus begin 10 days of joint military drills today in a ratcheting up of tensions on Ukraine's border. Russia now has 30,000 troops, two battalions of S-400 surface to air missile systems and numerous fighter jets in Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The effect stretches Ukrainian troops and has prompted Kiev into holding its own military drills.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The maneuvers come as Western leaders continue diplomatic efforts to de-escalate the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is involved in the current flurry of diplomatic activity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Speaking alongside Denmark's prime minister, he claims there are signs of progress in helping to stop Russia from invading Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Of course, there remain serious points of difference in how we see things during these discussions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But there are discussions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The OSCE has likewise become again a platform for exchange on security in Europe, which we always stressed, and this is progress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Scholz will travel to Kiev and then Moscow next week for his first face-to-face meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Britain's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss has arrived in Moscow for a two-day visit for talks with her counterpart Sergei Lavrov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And the UK's Prime Minister Boris Johnson will be in Poland for continuing diplomacy discussions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Last month, Russia announced it was staging various drills on land and at sea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Moscow continues to deny it intends to invade Ukraine, but insists its security concerns over NATO expansion must be addressed by the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: over NATO expansion must be addressed by the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Well, a rare bit of optimism, a little bit of optimism at least, coming from the German capital Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Olaf Scholz has said that the strategy currently taking place in order to deal with Russia's build-up of troops along the Ukrainian border, well, it seems to be somewhat working, at least for the moment, he said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And he's talking about a dual strategy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Diplomacy, on one hand, something that the German chancellor himself have become more and more involved with over the last few weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And on the other hand, the more pressure side of things, putting pressure on Russia, talking about sanctions that will be very severe if the country does attack Ukraine and also sending arms to Ukraine, something that other NATO members rather than Germany have done.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This diplomatic part of this strategy will continue here in Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Olaf Scholz will be holding meetings with the three leaders of the Baltic states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And also a crucial meeting is supposed to take place here in Berlin it will put Russia and Ukraine in the same room together with France and Germany in the so-called Normandy format meeting this will be a lower level meeting certainly not the leaders or secretaries or ministers taking place, but lower-level diplomats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But at the same time, it is still crucial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And it comes two weeks after the same type of meeting happened in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And the hope is that this Normandy format will also be a way to find a diplomatic solution to this crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Jonah Kellgren, Euronews, Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: crisis. Jonah Kellgren, Euronews, Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Japan's traditionally been the world's biggest importer of liquefied natural gas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But now it's decided to divert some LNG cargoes to Europe after requests from the United States and the European Union in the light of the Ukraine crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The gas shipments are expected to arrive next month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Japan has secured enough LNG to meet domestic demand so far, although it is not in abundance. While international situations develop as with Ukraine, Japan needs to align with G7 countries, especially those with whom Japan shares the same values." The United States and European allies have pledged economic and political sanctions if Russia moves its military into Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But they worry Russia may respond by halting its natural gas supplies to Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: 40% of the EU's natural gas imports come from Russia, with demand high in winter, as do nearly one-third of its crude oil imports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The energy crisis was high on the agenda in Washington.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Today our environment is characterized by the geopolitical turbulence in the context of Russia and Crimea crisis and energy issues are central to this crisis because Russia doesn't hesitate to use the significant energy supplies to Europe as a leverage for geopolitical gains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: US President Joe Biden, meeting with Germany's Chancellor Olaf Scholz, vowed to shut down the controversial Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline from Russia to Europe if Moscow launches an invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Scholz, however, remained more ambiguous, promising only that he was united with Biden. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, JOSEPH BIDEN, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, JOSEPH BIDEN, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, JOSEPH BIDEN, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, JOSEPH BIDEN, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, The Washington Post-Covid-19 Storyline, JOSEPH BIDEN, The Washington Post-Covid- stone in the development of fusion energy, the same process that powers the stars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The research team at the Joint European Taurus Facility in the UK blew past their own world record for energy extracted from the fusing of two hydrogen atoms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Fifty-nine megajoules over five seconds, enough to power 35,000 homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They're calling the results groundbreaking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The great thing about fusion is there's no long-lived radioactive waste.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The product of the reaction is helium, which is just a gas that actually stays in the plasma and heats the plasma and eventually is pumped away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So there is no significant waste issue with fusion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If nuclear fusion can be recreated on Earth, it has the potential to produce virtually unlimited supplies of low-carbon, low-radiation energy. But its practical application is still many years away. Currently, nuclear fusion experiments consume more energy than they produce. The next milestone will be demonstrating scientific break-even. A suspected drunk truck driver in Germany has been arrested after plowing into more

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: than 30 parked cars, setting some of them on fire and damaging a building.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Three people were injured in the crash, including the driver.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Witnesses say he skipped a red light, touching a car that was at a crossroads, and then carried on without stopping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Paris police force issued a statement banning the French Freedom Convoy, inspired by Canada's trucker blockade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The protesters are making their way from the south of France in convoys of vehicles to the capital, and then on to Brussels to protest the COVID-19 restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Authorities reminded the public that blocking roads is punishable with up to two years in prison, a driving ban of up to three years and a 4,500 euro fine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Accused Bataclan terrorist Salah Abdeslam shocked a Paris court on Wednesday after

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: taking the stand for the first time since his trial began five months ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Breaking his silence, he declared that he did not hurt or kill anyone on the night of the Paris attacks on November 13th, 2015.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the deadliest attack on French soil since World War II, 130 people were killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Nine gunmen targeted bars, restaurants, the Bataclan concert hall and the Stade de France before either being killed by police or killing themselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The 32-year-old accused has admitted to being a member of the so-called Islamic State group and downplayed the attacks as nothing personal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He also claimed that he isn't a danger to society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For Philippe Duperron, president of the Victims Association 13-11-15, it's the symbolism of the trial that matters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: As soon as we get to the real matter, meaning what is the mission, why and how, where they're sent, we see at that moment that they don't really hide behind their right to remain silent, but that they answer in a very evasive way and they don't give the real answers." Fourteen people have been put on trial for their connections or involvement in the Paris attacks, including Abdeslam and his brother Brahim, who was one of the attackers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Six others are being tried in absentia, five of whom are believed to be deceased.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The verdict is expected to be delivered in May.
